src:
Pomemben del turizma
05 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Igor Mušič

Konec tedna sta Javni zavod za šport Nova Gorica in Kajakaški center Solkan gostila prireditve tretjega čezmejnega gorskega teka treh vrhov. Kraljevsko preizkušnjo na 58 kilometrov sta dobila Ivan Hrastovec in Urša Trobec.



Najboljši na 58 km (z leve): Andrej Lindič, Ivan Hrastovec in Ajet Mani. Foto: Igor Mušič

SOLKAN > Organizatorji, na čelu z goriškim tekaškim zanesenjakom Miho Repičem, so na tretjo izvedbo mednarodnega čezmejnega teka po poteh treh vrhov bojev prve svetovne vojne (Škabrijel, Sveta Gora in Sabotin) privabili 336 gorskih tekačev iz sedmih držav.
Udeležencem so bili na voljo trije teki. Najzahtevnejši je na 58 kilometrih tekače utrujal še z 2864 višinskimi metri vzponov in s prav takšno količino spustov. Tekači so na tej preizkušnji morali med skoraj 700 metrov visokima Škabrijelom in Sabotinom preteči še nekakšno veliko podkev: ves rob Banjške planote do Kanalskega vrha, se spustiti v dolino Soče (sto metrov nad morjem) in se nato dvigniti na najvišjo točko teka, dobrih 812 metrov visoko Korado, ter se nato vračati proti Solkanu. Na poti so se morali spoprijeti tudi s plazenjem skozi kaverne in z veslanjem čez Sočo, katere gladina je le 50 metrov nad morsko.
Kljub vetru, dežju, spolzkim skalam in megli so na najdaljši progi odstopili le štirje tekači, zmagal pa je prekaljeni štajerski gorski ultramaratonec Ivan Hrastovec z Vranskega, ki je s progo opravi v šestih urah, minuti in devetih sekundah. Izvrstno se je odrezal član društva Postojna teče Andrej Lindič, ki je osvojil absolutno drugo mesto s časom 6:55,49. Na cilju je povedal: “Zmagati nisem mogel, saj se z dolgimi teki v naravi ne ukvarjam tako resno kot Ivan. Tečem predvsem za zdravje. Vesel sem, da se je dirka razpletla tako, da smo imeli zanimiv boj za mesta med drugim in petim in da sem ostal na čelu te skupine.”
Ženska zmaga je šla na Gorenjsko. Slavila je članica Kluba gorskih tekačev Papež iz Kamnika Urša Trobec (8:11,16), srebro pa si je priborila Tina Medved (ŠD Soške elektrarne, 8:40,45).
“Atraktivna in tehnično zahtevna proga mi je ustrezala. Na njej sem kar uživala. Imela sem tudi podporo navijačev. Organizatorji so se izkazali z lepo razporejenimi okrepčevalnicami in oznakami,” je svojo tekmo komentirala Tolminka. Bila je del manjšine tekačev, ki so v cilj prišli pred temo. Ostali so se morali skozi gozdove in med iskanjem oznak dve do tri ure prebijati tudi s prižganimi čelnimi svetilkami.
Tek na 28 km je postregel s 1672 metri višinske razlike vzponov in spustov. Tudi na tej progi so bili primorski tekači izvrstni, saj je absolutno zmagal Janez Žen iz Budanj, ki je v cilj pritekel po dveh urah 48 minutah in 52 sekundah. Dokaj prepričljivo je ugnal prvega zasledovalca Aleša Debeljaka iz ŠD Ljubljanske mlekarne (2:52,24).
“Trasa je bila zanimiva, precej energije pa je pobrala spolzka podlaga. Brez krčev in padcev ni šlo, a sem se srečno izvlekel in se v drugem delu proge z dvigom ritma otresel konkurence,” je povedal primorski zmagovalec.
V ženski konkurenci so vse stopničke zmagovalnega odra zasedle Primorke. Zmagala je Kristina Kržišnik (3:44,10) pred Asto Gregorič (3:48,37) in Tino Oberstar (3: 52,46).
Tek na 12 kilometrov s 600 metri višinske razlike je dobil član KD Brda Matic Plaznik, ki je bil v cilju v manj kot uri (57,58). Drugo mesto je osvojil Ajdovec Elis Filipič (59,44). V ženski konkurenci je bila najhitrejša Nika Mazi iz okolice Ljubljane (1:13,48), najboljši primorski dosežek pa je s tretjim mestom prispevala Vipavka Kristina Vanceta (1:19,33).
Organizator Miha Repič je bil z mislimi hitro že pri četrtem Teku treh vrhov: “Tekači so dobro sprejeli uvedbo tretjega najdaljšega teka. Škoda je le vremena, ki je nekoliko zmanjšalo število udeležencev. Naš osnovni namen je pokazati tekačem naše hribe, poti, zgodovino, kulturno in naravno dediščino. Tek v naravi je namreč postal pomemben del turizma, tu pa smo še daleč od tega, da bi v polnosti izkoristili vse, kar naše območje lahko ponudi. Vesel sem, da se je tek končal brez zdravstvenih težav in da se je dober glas o njem razširil. Za to gre posebna zahvala več kot sto prostovoljcem iz društev z obeh strani meje.”
Sledi tekaški pozdrav jeseni
Ljubitelji teka in hitre hoje se bodo lahko spet tekmovalno srečali v soboto pri sežanskem stadionu, kjer domači zavod za šport, turizem in prosti čas prireja Tekaški pozdrav jeseni na Krasu. Program se bo začel ob 9.40 z otroškimi teki na razdaljah od 300 do 1100 metrov. Uro kasneje bo od tam organiziran prevoz na startno mesto teka odraslih na 5800 metrov, ob 11. uri pa bo v Sežani še start desetkilometrskega teka. Zadnje športno dejanje bo ob 12.30, ko se bodo pomerili še specialisti za hitro hojo.
Prijave in informacije: elektronska p0šta info@sport-sezana.com in telefon051/339-759.



Tekači (v belem je zmagovalec na 28 km Janez Žen) so morali tudi veslati čez Sočo. Foto: Igor Mušič



Za večino tekačev je v slabem vremenu zmago predstavljal že prihod v cilj. Foto: Igor Mušič



Organizator Miha Repič Foto: Igor Mušič
text:
An important part of tourism
05 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Igor Mušič

At the end of the week, the Public Institute for Sport Nova Gorica and the Kayak Center Solkan hosted the events of the third cross-border mountain running of the three peaks. The 58-kilometer royal trial was won by Ivan Hrastovec and Urša Trobec.



Best at 58 km (from left): Andrej Lindic, Ivan Hrastovec and Ajet Mani. Photo: Igor Music

SOLKAN> The organizers, led by Gorizia cross-country enthusiast Miho Repic, attracted 336 mountain runners from seven countries to the third international cross-border run along the routes of the three World War I summits (Skabriel, Sveta Gora and Sabotin).
Participants were offered three runs. The most demanding of all, at 58 kilometers, the runners tired with 2864 altitude meters of ascents and the same amount of descents. At this test, the runners had to pass some large horseshoe between almost 700 meters high Škabriel and Sabotin: the entire edge of the Banjska plateau to the Channel top, descend into the Soča valley (one hundred meters above the sea) and then ascend to the highest running point, a good 812 meters high Corado, and then return to Solkan. Along the way, they also had to crawl through the caverns and paddle across the Soča River, whose surface is only 50 meters above sea level.
Despite the wind, rain, slippery rocks and fog, only four runners took the longest route, and the victorious Styrian mountain ultramarathon Ivan Hrastovec from Vransko won the race in six hours, minutes and nine seconds. The postojna running member Andrej Lindič, who finished in absolute second place with a time of 6: 55,49, excelled. He said at the finish: “I couldn't win because I don't take long runs in nature as seriously as Ivan. I run primarily for health. I'm glad the race came to fruition so we had an interesting fight for places between 5th and 5th and that I remained at the forefront of this group. "
The women's victory went to the Gorenjska region. The member of the Mountain Runners Club Pope from Kamnik was celebrated by Urša Trobec (8: 11,16) and silver was won by Tina Medved (ŠD Soške elektrarne, 8: 40,45).
“The attractive and technically challenging track suited me. I just enjoyed it. I also had the support of the fans. The organizers proved to have beautifully arranged refreshments and labels, ”Tolminka commented on her match. She was part of a minority of runners who came to the finish in the dark. The others also had to work their way through the woods and search for tags for two to three hours with their headlights on.
At 28 km, the elevation and descent difference was 1,672 meters. The coastal runners were excellent on this route as well, as Janez Zhen from Budanj absolutely won, reaching the finish line after two hours 48 minutes and 52 seconds. Quite convincingly, he chased away the first pursuer, Ales Debeljak, from the Ljubljana Dairy (2: 52.24).
“The route was interesting and a lot of energy was picked up by the slippery surface. No crashes and falls did not go, but I happily pulled out and in the second part of the track, with the rhythm rise, competed, ”said the coastal winner.
In the women's competition, all podium stages were occupied by Primorka. Kristina Kržišnik (3: 44,10) won against Asto Gregorič (3: 48,37) and Tina Oberstar (3: 52,46).
The 12 km distance with 600 meters of altitude difference was given to KD Brda member Matic Plaznik, who was in the target in less than an hour (57.58). Second place went to Ajdovec Elis Filipič (59.44). In the women's competition, the fastest was Nika Mazi from the Ljubljana area (1: 13.48), with Kristin Vancet (Vipavka Kristina Vanceta) (1: 19.33) with the third place.
The organizer Miha Repič was quick in his mind for the fourth Run of the Three Summits: “Runners were well received for the introduction of the third longest run. The only bad thing is the weather, which slightly reduced the number of participants. Our primary purpose is to show runners our hills, trails, history, cultural and natural heritage. Running in nature has become an important part of tourism, but we are still far from fully utilizing what our area has to offer. I'm glad the run ended with no health issues and the good news about it spread. This is a special thank you to more than one hundred volunteers from societies on both sides of the border. ”
This is followed by a running greeting in the fall
Lovers of running and speed walking will be able to meet again on Saturday at the Sežana stadium, where the home institute for sports, tourism and leisure organizes a Running Greetings in the Karst in the autumn. The program will start at 9.40 am with the kids running at distances of 300 to 1100 meters. An hour later, there will be organized transportation to the starting point of adult running at 5800 meters, and at 11.00 there will be another 10 km run in Sežana. The last sporting event will be at 12.30pm, when more walking specialists will compete.
Applications and information: email info@sport-sezana.com and phone051 / 339-759.



Runners (in white is 28 km winner Janez Zen) also had to paddle across the Soča River. Photo: Igor Music



For most runners, in poor weather, victory was already a goal. Photo: Igor Music



Organizer Miha Repic Photo: Igor Music
